page.title: 10Religion In A Camden School1
page.content: In our school there are children of many different nationalities and religions. The majority of children in our school are Muslims, then Cristions with a few Jews and Hindus. A large number of children say they have no religion. Every day we have an assembly, with stories from various religions or stories with a moral. Some times a class talkes about the work they have been doing. We did an assembly on the Domesday Project. We made a song to go with it. Three of our class write about their religion. Gayatri is a hindu. "My name means G-D. We go to temple every week and give our G-D's food. We have many G-D's. This time we gave food to Ram. We pray at home too. Our special festival is Divali which celebrates the home coming of the Ram. We give presents and have parties."
